embeds.title: Time Warp
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost

Deal 4 (6) damage.
Whenever you Advance or Retract, return this from the discard pile.

messages.content: interesting card

how useful is it?
not sure
I think it's alright, it can help with getting the stupid attack ghostflames done fast if you advance into them.
But for a rare I feel like it's a little low-impact.
damn the strategy channel awas so little talked in it that we got 2 daily threads in a row
yeah
feels like Hexa's version of <Flurry of Blows>

embeds.title: Flurry of Blows
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 0 :e_purple: / The Watcher

Deal 4 (6) damage.
Whenever you change **Stance**s, return this from the discard pile to your hand.

messages.content: or hexa's version of <one two combo>

embeds.title: One-Two Combo
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 0 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss

Deal 3 damage.
 ( **Command.** )
When you **Split,** return this from the discard pile to your hand.

messages.content: But also rare instead of common, even though stance entry is way more common than advancing or retracting

except it
-activates less often than both of them (theres barely any advance / retract in the pool) 
-has less of an effect than both of them (no command, no benefit fron wrath)
not even vuln value
It does synergize with the attack ghostflame, but I don't think that it warrants it being rare.
yeah
iirc Stanek's got an idea to rework it
or at least change the name
Would be cool if it activated one part of the ghostflame? Instead of the full thing, just 1 proc.
dumb rework idea: deals much more than 4 dmg, but discards when drawn and draws 1 card when time warp is drawn so you need to advance or retract to use it
what?
what indeed
aslo my message wasnt reacting to urs
That doesn't make sense?
yes
i came up with the idea in like 3 seconds flat
ignite half a ghostflame?
So add a <prepared> to it?

embeds.title: Prepared
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 0 :e_green: / The Silent

Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
Discard 1 (2) card (cards).

messages.content: Yes.
no i mean like
when you draw time warp, discard said time warp and draw 1 card
2 time warps is a softlock
infinitely drawing each other
is this a good idea besides that softlock?
I mean, hypothetically it would just kinda be like an adrenaline. Never a bad take, since it only will at worst case be draw neutral without even needing to be played.
So it would only ever be skipped if you want one of the other options more.
it would be like quartz
but if you didn't even need to play it.
So against watcher 3 or time eater

This card is fine. Hexaghost is usually going with a thick deck so you get to play this a few times per shuffle and it does some chip damage for you. The card can be inconsistent though since it can be on the bottom of the deck and be useless
I don't normally retract when I play hexaghost though so this is just coming from advance
same
I don't think I've made Devil's Dance work yet
<devils dance>

embeds.title: Devil's Dance
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 (1) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost

The first time you Retract each turn, gain **:e_hexa:** and draw 1 card.
**Retract.**

messages.content: pretty awful card if your asking me. Its extremely clunky and slow due to the lack of cards that retract.
yeah
I guess the upgrade technically makes it a cantrip?
which is the weirdest phrase I've written today
"cantrip power"

retract is usually bad anyways; so your putting this into a deck thats not using ghostflames much. Witch is probably something like soulburn stacking with cards like here and now and that one intangible card whos name I forgot.
<Incorporeal>

embeds.title: Incorporeal
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost

**Retract.**
Lose 5 (3) HP.
Gain 1 **Intangible:p_intangible:**.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: but those decks don't show up that often and its not like devils dance is going to make them insane since its only active once a turn
yeah
I wonder how the card would do if it gave no energy and just drew a card on each retract
it's like Dancing Master, if there were like three finishers in the entire card pool
<float+>

embeds.title: Float
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost

Draw a card.
 (You may choose to)
hexamod: ( Retract or hexamod: )Advance.

messages.content: The comparison to flurry of blows is apt, it functions in almost exactly the same way, but is rare, much harder to trigger (especially multiple times in a turn) and doesn't naturally benefit from the condition being met in the same way (wrath doubling the damage of flurry making it an even better damage card). For what it's worth, I like time warp existing in hexaghosts pool, it works very well with all the attack multiple times relics (shuriken, kunai, pen nib, nunchaku), but it really doesn't make much sense as a rare, I feel like it could be a common with no problem. It does at least help ignite the 2 attack ghostflames, but even as a  front-loaded damage option for short hallway fights, it gets outshined by most of the afterlife stuff.
One option if you want to keep a card like this rare is to make it more like 1 2 punch, maybe have it ignite the current ghostflame? I still think downshifting it makes the most sense though
why do people never mention <Ornamental Fan>

embeds.title: Ornamental Fan
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All

Every time you play 3 Attacks in a single turn, gain 4 **Block:p_block:**.
*The fan seems to extend and harden as blood is spilled.*

messages.content: Because hexaghost isn't really the character you spam attacks with
He has like two 0 cost attack aside from the afterlife stuff
With time wrap being one of them
And the other one is really situational and can screw you up if you play it at random times <attack detonate soulburn>

embeds.title: Phantom Fireball
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost

Deal 4 (7) damage.
If the enemy has Soulburn:p_soulburn:, detonate it.

messages.content: Considering time wrap is a rare card and it does next to no damage on its own how about making it exhume or at least reclaim one card as its upgrade?
Considering the name of the card it would be pretty thematic
And it would make it closer in its power to one-two combo
I take time warp more then one-two combo. That latter card feels pretty awful in most decks were as time warp is just an alright consolation prize rare.
both cards I think could just be uncommon though, as they are both low impact
one two combo is not low impact
if you have potency and can upgrade it sure; but its not doing much in most slime boss runs
if by "its not doing much in most slime boss runs" you mean "its a rare card so you dont see it often" then sure but ur just wrong on this otherwise
time warp is easier to pick, although it doesnt have as much potential.
no
theyre both 0 cost attacks neither are difficult to take
but hexa is a character with like no draw at all and you need to be using your draw to get to your afterlife cards so its gonna actively hurt you to add this to ur deck

I'm skipping most one-two combos I see; its just not fitting into most runs and I'd rather take the other rares. When I do pick the card its normally when its offered by itself or if I already have a deck that can make it strong.

Idk when I see 1 2 punch, especially already upgraded I rarely skip it. Worst case scenario you draw it last literally every turn and it is low damage and a command. Best case scenario you have a few split cards, and you draw it turn 1 and you get like 6 free commands off of it. If you consider that low impact, then idk what to tell you.
And with the starter split being changed to no longer exhaust, you'll have access to more splits meaning this gets even more value.
I know
but the person above me mentioned shuriken and kunai
